act:act.act:title: Veterinary Drugs Act
act:act.act:deposited: Deposited with Clerk of the Legislative Assembly on August 20, 2018

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an animal, whether alive or dead, other than a human, and
any other living organism other than a plant;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: drug has the same meaning as in the Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act;
medicated feed means animal feed containing a veterinary drug;
minister includes a person designated in writing by the minister;
pharmacist has the same meaning as in the Health Professions Act;
veterinarian means an individual who is authorized under the Veterinarians Act to practise veterinary medicine;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a drug used, or intended or represented to be used, as a drug for the treatment, prevention or diagnosis of a disease of an animal, and
a drug listed or included by reference in the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite this Act or the regulations, the minister may prohibit the use in British Columbia of any veterinary drug for veterinary purposes.
A person must not sell or represent any thing for sale as a drug or as a particular drug if the thing is not what it is represented to be.
A person must not sell a drug after the date on which the drug is indicated or labeled to expire.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not manufacture or sell medicated feeds or sell veterinary drugs unless the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is a pharmacist or veterinarian, or

has a valid licence issued under section 4 [licence to manufacture or sell] and manufactures or sells medicated feeds or sells veterinary drugs in compliance with the regulations and the terms and conditions of the licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person may apply to the minister for a licence to manufacture or sell medicated feeds or sell veterinary drugs by submitting

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an application in the prescribed form, and
the prescribed fee.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may issue a licence on terms or conditions the minister sets or the regulations prescribe.
If the minister determines that a person licensed under this section has contravened a term or condition of the person's licence, the minister may cancel that person's licence.
In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: authorized person means a person who, under section 3 [who may manufacture or sell], may manufacture or sell a medicated feed or sell a veterinary drug;
chief veterinarian has the same meaning as in the Animal Health Act;
veterinary drug dispenser means a person licensed under the regulations to dispense veterinary drugs.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the regulations require a veterinary drug dispenser to be on the premises of an authorized person, the authorized person must inform the chief veterinarian of the name and licence number of the veterinary drug dispenser normally present on the authorized person's premises during business hours.
In this section, wholesaler has the same meaning as in the Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act.
Nothing in this Act or the regulations prevents

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a pharmacist or veterinarian from directly dispensing a drug to the owner, or an agent of the owner, of an animal for which the drug has been prescribed, or

a wholesaler or manufacturer from selling a veterinary drug to a person licensed under section 4 [licence to manufacture or sell] to manufacture or sell medicated feed containing, or to sell, the veterinary drug.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may appoint inspectors.
An inspector may do the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: enter, during normal business hours, premises in which medicated feeds or veterinary drugs are sold to determine whether this Act and the regulations are being complied with;
examine and seize records relating to the manufacture, use or sale of medicated feeds or veterinary drugs;

enter any premises to inspect any of the following things, and remove the thing or a sample of the thing, if the inspector believes on reasonable grounds that the thing contains a substance specified by the minister to be harmful to the health of humans or animals:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: animals, animal products or animal feed;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: examine and remove medicated feeds or veterinary drugs from premises at which they are manufactured or sold, if the inspector believes on reasonable grounds that the sale of the medicated feeds or veterinary drugs is prohibited or that the stated expiry date has passed;
perform other duties imposed by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An inspector may keep any thing removed under this section to be dealt with under section 8 [dealing with things removed during inspection].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Dealing with things removed during inspection

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a thing removed under section 7 (2) (c) [appointment and powers of inspectors] and analyzed contains a substance the minister considers to be dangerous to the health of a human or animal, the minister may do either of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: direct the thing to be destroyed;
prohibit the sale, manufacture or use of the thing for the period the minister considers necessary.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a medicated feed or veterinary drug removed under section 7 (2) cannot be lawfully sold by the person from whom the medicated feed or veterinary drug was removed, the minister may direct that it be destroyed.
The minister and the government are not liable to pay compensation for an economic loss that may occur as a result of any action taken in good faith under this section.
Section 5 of the Offence Act does not apply to this Act.
A person who contravenes section 2 (2) or (3) [prohibited uses, sales and representations] or 3 [who may manufacture or sell] commits an offence.
If a person contravenes this Act or the regulations in the course of employment, the employer or manager of the person is deemed to have contravened the same enactment.

If a corporation commits an offence under this Act, an officer, director, employee or agent of the corporation who directed, authorized, assented to, acquiesced or participated in the commission of the offence is deemed to have contravened the same enactment.
In a prosecution under this Act, it is sufficient to prove that the accused has committed on one occasion any of the acts prohibited by this Act or the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If evidence is introduced against a defendant in a prosecution under this Act that a sign, title, advertisement or word has been published or used contrary to this Act or the regulations, the onus is on the defendant to prove that it was not published or used by that defendant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, certificate means a certificate of analysis from an analyst designated under the Food and Drugs Act (Canada) stating

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the analyst has analyzed or examined a substance, and
the result of the analysis or examination.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A certificate is admissible in evidence in a proceeding under this Act and is evidence of the statements contained in the certificate.
The person against whom a certificate is to be used may, with leave of the court, require the analyst to attend and be cross-examined.
Reasonable notice of an intention to introduce a certificate in evidence must be given to the person against whom the certificate is to be used, along with a copy of that certificate.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who sells anything in contravention of this Act or the regulations is not entitled to recover payment for the sale.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the Interpretation Act.
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purposes of the definition of "veterinary drug" in section 1, respecting the listing of a drug or inclusion of a drug by reference in a drug schedule;
respecting the amount of a drug listed or included by reference in a drug schedule that may be

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: added to feeding mashes to prevent, control or treat animal diseases, or
used to prevent, control or treat specific animal diseases;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purposes of section 4 [licence to manufacture or sell], respecting

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the form of an application, application fees and the qualifications required by applicants, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting licence duration, renewal, cancellation, suspension, extent and production;
for the purposes of section 5 [if veterinary drug dispenser required], respecting

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the presence of a veterinary drug dispenser if veterinary drugs or medicated feeds are sold, and
training and licensing for veterinary drug dispensers;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting the keeping and inspection of registers of licences and the submission of fees;
respecting the storage, transportation and sale of veterinary drugs;
for the purposes of section 7 (2) (c) [appointment and powers of inspectors], respecting

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the analysis of a thing listed in that provision, and
the maximum residue content of a veterinary drug in a thing subject to analysis under that provision;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establishing an advisory committee on veterinary drugs and specifying the committee's duties.

bcl:conseqhead.bcl:text: Revision Schedule — Consequential Amendments to Other Acts

bcl:editorialnote.in:em: [Note: See Table of Legislative Changes for the status of this Revision Schedule.]
